result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle D. Knolle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted, if any, shall be applied.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
    Perform  40    hours of community service for a public agency or a nonprofit charitable organization.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle D. Knolle

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of unpaid court obligations still due and owing after discharge from Dept of Corrections

Notice of court ordered financial obligations received; defendant scheduled to discharge from Department of Corrections with unpaid court obligations; per Judgement of Conviction civil judgment entered for balance of unpaid court obligations.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Defendant, Kyle D. Knolle, appeared with Attorney Rocco DeFilippis.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved.  DE pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence is withheld and DE is placed on probation for 1 year with conditions.  Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and written notice provided to defendant.  Credit for 6 days if revoked.  As a condition he is ordered to complete 40 hrs of community service.   Cash Bond on deposit shall be applied.  Appeal Rights given.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

and  Demand for Discovery
Submitted by ADA Thomas Binger

1:59  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Johnson. Clerk LE.   Plea of Not Guilty entered. Atty Johnson moves to dismiss complaint. Court denies motion. PTC 5-1-15 @ 2:10 pm, FPT 6-5-15 @ 9:30 am   $250.00 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.
